The plant features bipinnate leaves with small, linear leaflets that give it a delicate appearance. It produces yellow flowers in spring, which are clustered in spherical inflorescences. Acacia mitodes is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in harsh climates.

This species thrives in sandy soils and is commonly found in coastal and inland areas. It is an important part of the local flora and is adapted to the dry and sunny conditions of the region.
